docs.snippet: Ireland has met American safety rules, becoming the first European country to come off a ban that was imposed after an outbreak of mad cow disease in the late 1990s.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ireland has met American safety rules, becoming the first European country to come off a ban that was imposed after an outbreak of mad cow disease in the late 1990s.
docs.abstract: Ireland will begin exporting its beef to United States, after longtime ban on beef from Europe is lifted; ban was imposed in late 1990s over mad cow disease outbreak; Ireland is first country to satisfy US safety requirements.

headline.main: After Ban on Beef From Europe, U.S. Gives Green Light to Ireland
headline.print_headline: After Longtime Ban on Beef From Europe, U.S. Gives the Green Light to Ireland

docs.snippet: Three misconceptions are holding up the end of this stain on America.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three misconceptions are holding up the end of this stain on America.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Cliff Sloan reflects on his tenure as State Department's special envoy for closing the Guantanamo Bay prison; holds reasons for closure are more compelling than ever, and path remains clear, though it will require intense and sustained action; examines three fundamental misconceptions that have impeded process, such as danger posed by freed detainees, especially among some members of Congress.

docs.snippet: Winning the right to host the World Cup was only part of the challenge facing Qatar. The second, and seemingly more difficult, was to develop a team good enough to make a splash when the tournament goes to the Middle East for the first time.
docs.lead_paragraph: Winning the right to host the World Cup was only part of the challenge facing Qatar. The second, and seemingly more difficult, was to develop a team good enough to make a splash when the tournament goes to the Middle East for the first time.

headline.main: Ibrahim Shows Qatar's Home Grown Talent Can Succeed
headline.print_headline: Ibrahim Shows Qatar's Home Grown Talent Can Succeed

docs.snippet: Uruguayan police found what appeared to be a simulated explosive device Thursday about 100 meters (yards) from an office complex housing the Israeli Embassy, the Interior Ministry reported.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguayan police found what appeared to be a simulated explosive device Thursday about 100 meters (yards) from an office complex housing the Israeli Embassy, the Interior Ministry reported.

headline.main: Uruguay: Seeming Explosive Device Found Near Israel Embassy
headline.print_headline: Uruguay: Seeming Explosive Device Found Near Israel Embassy

docs.snippet: A selected guide to readings, discussions, exhibitions and other cultural events in New York City.
docs.lead_paragraph: A selected guide to readings, discussions, exhibitions and other cultural events in New York City.

docs.snippet: Jordan coach Ray Wilkins is convinced Prince Ali bin Al Hussein is the right man to clean up FIFA's tarnished image and the former England captain will be hoping the royal can reciprocate his support in a similarly tough battle.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jordan coach Ray Wilkins is convinced Prince Ali bin Al Hussein is the right man to clean up FIFA's tarnished image and the former England captain will be hoping the royal can reciprocate his support in a similarly tough battle.

headline.main: Struggling Wilkins Supports Prince Ali's FIFA Bid
headline.print_headline: Struggling Wilkins Supports Prince Ali's FIFA Bid

docs.snippet: The U.N. General Assembly will hold an informal meeting on the growth of anti-Semitism on Jan. 22 in response to a request from dozens of nations, including Israel, the United States and all European Union members.
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N. General Assembly will hold an informal meeting on the growth of anti-Semitism on Jan. 22 in response to a request from dozens of nations, including Israel, the United States and all European Union members.

headline.main: UN to Hold Meeting Jan. 22 on Growth of Anti-Semitism
headline.print_headline: UN to Hold Meeting Jan. 22 on Growth of Anti-Semitism

docs.snippet: Cristiano Ronaldo won the FIFA Ballon d'Or award for the second year running and the third overall on Monday and said he wanted to become "one of the greatest players of all time."
docs.lead_paragraph: Cristiano Ronaldo won the FIFA Ballon d'Or award for the second year running and the third overall on Monday and said he wanted to become "one of the greatest players of all time."

headline.main: Ronaldo Wins Another Ballon d'Or Award
headline.print_headline: Ronaldo Wins Another Ballon d'Or Award

docs.snippet: A piece of the original World Cup trophy, which was stolen in Brazil in 1983 and never recovered, has been found in a basement at FIFA's headquarters.
docs.lead_paragraph: A piece of the original World Cup trophy, which was stolen in Brazil in 1983 and never recovered, has been found in a basement at FIFA's headquarters.

headline.main: Part of Original World Cup Trophy Found in FIFA Basement
headline.print_headline: Part of Original World Cup Trophy Found in FIFA Basement

docs.snippet: Former U.S. Open champion Juan Martin del Potro stepped up his comeback from another wrist surgery by toppling top seed Fabio Fognini at the Sydney International on Wednesday.

headline.main: Del Potro and Kvitova Claim Three Set Wins in Sydney
